bugs.title: mingw-openexr: openexr: Out-of-memory in openexr_exrcheck_fuzzer could lead to a crash [fedora-all]

bugzilla.short_desc: mingw-openexr: openexr: Out-of-memory in openexr_exrcheck_fuzzer could lead to a crash [fedora-all]

blocked.short_desc: openexr: Out-of-memory in openexr_exrcheck_fuzzer could lead to a crash

long_desc.thetext:
OpenEXR before 3.1.5 runs out of memory in openexr_exrcheck_fuzzer leading to a crash.

References: 

https://bugs.chromium.org/p/oss-fuzz/issues/detail?id=44084

Created OpenEXR tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 2077552]


Created mingw-openexr tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 2077554]

This is an automatically created tracking bug!  It was created to ensure
that one or more security vulnerabilities are fixed in affected versions
of fedora-all.

For comments that are specific to the vulnerability please use bugs filed
against the "Security Response" product referenced in the "Blocks" field.

For more information see:
http://fedoraproject.org/wiki/Security/TrackingBugs

When submitting as an update, use the fedpkg template provided in the next
comment(s).  This will include the bug IDs of this tracking bug as well as
the relevant top-level CVE bugs.

Please also mention the CVE IDs being fixed in the RPM changelog and the
fedpkg commit message.

NOTE: this issue affects multiple supported versions of Fedora. While only
one tracking bug has been filed, please correct all affected versions at
the same time.  If you need to fix the versions independent of each other,
you may clone this bug as appropriate.

Use the following template to for the 'fedpkg update' request to submit an
update for this issue as it contains the top-level parent bug(s) as well as
this tracking bug.  This will ensure that all associated bugs get updated
when new packages are pushed to stable.

=====

type=security

# low, medium, high, urgent (required)
severity=low

# testing, stable
request=testing

# Bug numbers: 1234,9876
bugs=2077549,2077554

# Description of your update
notes=Security fix for [PUT CVEs HERE]

# Enable request automation based on the stable/unstable karma thresholds
autokarma=True
stable_karma=3
unstable_karma=-3

# Automatically close bugs when this marked as stable
close_bugs=True

# Suggest that users restart after update
suggest_reboot=False

Additionally, you may opt to use the bodhi web interface to submit updates:

https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/new
FEDORA-2022-c6a4682590 has been submitted as an update to Fedora 36. https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2022-c6a4682590

FEDORA-2022-c6a4682590 has been pushed to the Fedora 36 stable repository.
If problem still persists, please make note of it in this bug report.

bugs.title: mingw-openexr: openexr: Integer-overflow in internal_exr_compute_chunk_offset_size could lead to a crash [fedora-all]

bugzilla.short_desc: mingw-openexr: openexr: Integer-overflow in internal_exr_compute_chunk_offset_size could lead to a crash [fedora-all]

blocked.short_desc: openexr: Integer-overflow in internal_exr_compute_chunk_offset_size could lead to a crash

long_desc.thetext:
OpenEXR before 3.1.5 has an Integer-overflow in internal_exr_compute_chunk_offset_size which could lead to a crash. 

References: 

https://bugs.chromium.org/p/oss-fuzz/issues/detail?id=45899

Created OpenEXR tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 2077553]

bugs.title: mingw-openexr: openexr: Heap-buffer-overflow in Imf_3_1::memstream_read could lead to a crash [fedora-all]

bugzilla.short_desc: mingw-openexr: openexr: Heap-buffer-overflow in Imf_3_1::memstream_read could lead to a crash [fedora-all]

blocked.short_desc: openexr: Heap-buffer-overflow in Imf_3_1::memstream_read could lead to a crash

long_desc.thetext:
OpenEXR before 3.1.5 is vulnerable to Heap-buffer-overflow in Imf_3_1::memstream_read 

References: 

https://bugs.chromium.org/p/oss-fuzz/issues/detail?id=46309

Created OpenEXR tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 2077559]


Created mingw-openexr tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 2077557]
This was due to a bug in the CheckFile function in libOpenEXRUtil. CheckFile's sole purpose is for fuzz testing
